segments.text: I see the water pouring over the edge of the sink, creating a little waterfall onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost mesmerizing, the way it just keeps flowing without stopping.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it’s been like this and why no one has noticed yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t felt the water on her foot or heard the sound of it splashing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like she’s in a trance, completely focused on that one plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the kids are being so sneaky, grabbing cookies while her back is turned.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I’m watching a slow-motion disaster unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just hope someone notices before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then again, maybe it’s better if I just watch and see what happens.
segments.speaker: PAR
